title: (x) square type on cover The Face - custom design by Neville Brody {Thierry Blancpain (self)}
content:
im looking for typeface that was designed - if i remember correctly - for the cover and or logo of a magazine in the 90ies (or end of the 80ies). i think i saw it on typophile once, but cant find it anymore.

its made of straight lines and has a similar feeling to [this typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20061202015306/http:/www.art.ificial.ch/2005/octroy.gif) i did (but without round elements i think, it looked sharper). i thought the name of the magazine was ELEKTRA, but i also remember the S, so elektra is probably not right. i think the type was in red on the cover, but you see that its quite a distant memory ;)

any idea?
author: thierry blancpain

comments.content: no to both. the face isnt straight enough, new socialist is too detailed and playful. but brody could be the designer.

so what about Hard & Heavy ?

\> for the cover and or logo of a magazine in the 90ies (or end of the 80ies)

news & politics? lifestyles? style & fashion?
i would say either lifestyle or style & fashion from the picture i have in my head. i know, my memories are so precise! ;)

brody was right, i did some google-search on typophile and found it.. the tricky thing is, it was a face-cover, but the typeface was in a headline, not in the logo.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/files/Face842_4651.png)

[http://typophile.com/node/17631](http://web.archive.org/web/20061202015306/http:/typophile.com/node/17631)

“Two months later, the typeface later named Industria appeared in the magazine.” - but [industria on myfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20061202015306/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/industria/), designed by brody, isnt an exact fit - too round. is it possible to buy this typeface (ELECTRO)?

thank you for your help again, david.
any idea if the ELECTRO-typeface is available digitaly?

hmm.  
1. is there a similarly condensed typeface in this style available digitaly?  
2. whats your take of loosely basing a font on those letters for a personal project? im not nearly good enough to make a professional typeface anyway, so the biggest it could be would be a freefont (but i wouldnt have a problem not releasing it). it would just fit a project i had in mind for months. maybe asking mr. brody would be a way.

shall i start a new thread for this in the appropriate forum?

A font like this is extremely easy to slap together. I did a similar one last century (my first and only typeface) based on the lettering of a thriller by Mark Folsom. I think I called that one “Folsom”. It may still be around on the web (although that was in its infancy at the time). Don’t have it anymore myself, sorry…
